articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Rocket Firing Drill of Strategic Force of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Rocket Firing Drill of Strategic Force of KPA
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, guided a rocket firing drill of the strategic force of the KPA on the spot.
					 The drill was staged on July 26, a day before the anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. It was conducted by a firepower strike unit of the strategic force of the KPA tasked to strike bases of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea. 
					
					 He examined a firing plan mapped out in consideration of the present location of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' bases in south Korea and under the simulated conditions of the battle to strike and destroy them before guiding the drill.
					
					 The drill proved the high combat capability of the firepower strike unit and the perfect performance of its tactical rockets.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed his great satisfaction over a series of successful drills of the strategic force, saying: "Rocket test-fire drills were conducted many times recently to develop the Juche-based rocket science and technology and firing methods. As a result, the strategic force is fully ready to successfully carry out any firepower strike mission in modern warfare. The roar heard from today's firepower drill conducted to mark the war victory day is just like a thrilling gun report heralding the completion of the strategic force's combat preparations."
					
					 Stressing history can never be altered, concealed and cooked up, he recalled that the U.S. and the south Korean regime are staging a ridiculous charade of describing their past defeat in the war as "victorious one" through Obama's unjustifiable "speech" and Park Geun Hye's "presidential memorial address" made on the occasion of July 27, instead of drawing a lesson from their ignominious defeat in the past war.
					
					 He declared:
					
					 "Masters of the White House have been replaced by others since the 1950s. However, the U.S. harsh hostile policy toward the DPRK has not changed at all. It was the shameful tradition of the U.S. imperialists that they have sustained setbacks, hit hard in history, and it is the proud tradition of the DPRK that it has successfully foiled every reckless move pursued by the U.S., counting on its growing muscle. These law-governed two traditions will last forever in the future, too."
					
					 Whoever dares challenge the just cause of the service personnel and people of the DPRK is bound to meet a final ruin, he stressed, calling for wiping out the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea and other forces following them on this land at an early date and accomplishing the historic cause of national reunification without fail.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Yun Tong Hyon, Ri Pyong Chol, O Kum Chol and Pak Jong Chon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Watches Men's Volleyball Match
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Men's Volleyball Match
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, together with KPA service personnel, watched a men's volleyball match played between the April 25 Team and the Amnokgang Team on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The two teams played a good match by fully displaying the technique they have cultivated in their day-to-day training.
					
					 The April 25 Team beat its rival.
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated volleyballers on their successful match, expressing satisfaction over their high level of playing.
					
					 He underscored the need to round off Korean style sports technique, tactical system and training methods, put sports technique on a higher level and thus achieve signal successes in international games.
					
					 Putting the DPRK onto the position of a sports power is an important work to increase the national power in every way and demonstrate the indomitable spirit and dignity of Songun Korea before the whole world, he said, setting forth the tasks which would serve as guidelines for rapidly developing the nation's sports.
					
					 Among the spectators were Hwang Pyong So, O Kum Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Jae Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Yong Hun and Ri Jong Mu.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at 00:00 on July 27, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 He entered the hall where the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are standing.
					
					 The chief of a guard of honor of the Ground, Naval, Air and Anti-Air Forces of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a salute towards the statues.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 Also laid before them was a floral basket in the name of the KPA.
					
					 He, together with other visitors, paid high tribute to the statues.
					
					 He entered the hall where Kim Il Sung lies in state.
					
					 He, together with other visitors, paid homage to Kim Il Sung in the humblest reverence for him.
					
					 He went round the hall where orders Kim Il Sung received are preserved, the mourning hall and halls that house a train coach and car used by him.
					
					 He entered the hall where Kim Jong Il lies in state.
					
					 He, together with other visitors, paid homage to Kim Jong Il in the humblest reverence for him.
					
					 He went round the hall where orders Kim Jong Il received are preserved and halls that house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Hyon Yong Chol, Pyon In Son, So Hong Chan, Pak Yong Sik, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol and other KPA commanding officers and those of the services and corps-level units of the KPA.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Meet to Vow to Achieve Cause of National Reunification
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Meet to Vow to Achieve Cause of National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting of service personnel of the Ground, Naval, Air and Anti-Air Forces and Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army (KPA) took place at the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War. They vowed to glorify forever the undying feats President Kim Il Sung, invincible and iron-willed commander, and leader Kim Jong Il performed by winning the victory in the war against imperialism and achieve the great cause of national reunification under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					 Attending the meeting were KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA General Ri Yong Gil, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA General Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, and other commanding officers of the KPA, service personnel of the Ground, Naval and Air and Anti-Air Forces and Strategic Force, cadets of military schools at all levels.
					
					 The reviewing stands and the plaza park were taken by officials of the party, armed forces and power organs in Pyongyang, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people from all walks of life.
					
					 A 21-gun salute boomed amid the solemn playing of "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and "Song of General Kim Jong Il".
					
					 All the participants paid tribute to the images of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Hwang Pyong So in a speech pledged to glorify the undying feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in winning victories in the war against the imperialists and to achieve without fail the grand cause of national reunification under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 July 27 is the day of the second liberation and an auspicious holiday when the army and people of the DPRK honorably defended the freedom and independence of the country and demonstrated the stamina of heroic Korea and the dignity of the Korean nation under the leadership of Kim Il Sung, he said.
					
					 More than six decades have passed since the ceasefire and century and generations are replaced by others but the history and tradition of victory of Songun Korea are given steady continuity as it is led by Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 The speaker said that the army and people of the DPRK will always win victory and glorify for all ages the history and tradition of victory down through generations as it is led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 All the service personnel of the KPA will become the first lifeguards and death-defying corps of Kim Jong Un who will defend at the cost of their lives the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun and the Central Committee of the WPK, the banners of all victories and glory, just as heroic fighters of the 1950s did, he said.
					
					 He stressed the need to direct all efforts into rounding off the combat preparedness under the invariable banner of "Annihilate the U.S. imperialist aggressors, the sworn enemy of the Korean people!" and thus make the KPA an invincible and revolutionary elite and guerrillas of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called upon all service personnel to bring about a shining victory in the grand war for national reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Un just as heroic fighters brought about the war victory day, July 27.
					
					 There were speeches to vow pledges. The floor was taken by Lieutenant General Kim Sang Ryong, commander of the KPA Second Corps, Senior Vice Admiral Kim Myong Sik, commander of the KPA Navy, General of the Air Force Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force, and Colonel General of the Strategic Force Kim Rak Gyom, commander of the KPA Strategic Force. 
					
					 It was followed by the military parade of guards divisions, guards regiments and the Ground, Naval, Air and Anti-Air Force and Strategic Force of the KPA at the plaza to celebrate the 61st anniversary of the war victory.

articles.title: Anniversary of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Celebrated in DPRK
articles.content:
Anniversary of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War Celebrated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The army and the people of the DPRK significantly celebrated the 61st anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children across the country visited the statues and portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to pay high tribute to them. 
					
					 They visited the revolutionary sites associated with the feats for war victory performed by the President.
					
					 Service personnel, working people and school youth and children laid wreaths, bouquets and flowers before the statues of martyrs, cemeteries of martyrs, monuments to fallen fighters of the Korean People's Army and graves of martyrs across the country.
					
					 Art performances celebrating the day of war victory were given at theaters in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The revolutionary drama "Following the Banner of Victory" was given by the National Theatrical Troupe at the National Theatre.
					
					 A concert celebrating the day of war victory was given at the Moranbong Theatre.
					
					 Music and dance performance "July 27, Eternal Victory Day" was given by artistes of the National Folk Art Troupe at the Ponghwa Art Theater, the revolutionary opera "Sea of Blood" by artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe at the Pyongyang Grand Theater and colorful acrobatic pieces at the Pyongyang Circus Theater.
					
					 Performances were also given at the Jagang Provincial Art Theater, Hamhung Grand Theater and in other parts of the country.
					
					 Members of the women's union in Pyongyang revved up the atmosphere of the war V-day with chorus of wartime songs at the plazas of the Monument to Party Founding, the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and other different places of Pyongyang.
					
					 There took place in Jagang Province a contest of singing wartime songs in chorus of students and a performance given by members of art groups of the "1 000-ri Journey for Learning" Schoolchildren's Palace.
					
					 Members of the women's union in Songchongang District, Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province put on the stage songs reflecting the reverence for the illustrious commanders, and wartime songs.
					
					 Meetings with war veterans and sports and amusement games took place at the construction sites of stockbreeding base of Sepho Tableland and power stations in tiers on the Chongchon River.
					
					 Youth and students across the country significantly spent the day of war victory, presenting cheerful dances.

articles.title: Fireworks Celebrate War Victory Day
articles.content:
Fireworks Celebrate War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Fireworks were displayed in Pyongyang Sunday to celebrate the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 School youth and children and other people gathered in different parts of the capital including Kim Il Sung Square, Mansu Hill and Okryu Bridge along the River Taedong on the bank of which rises the Tower of the Juche Idea, waiting for the moment when fireworks will be displayed.
					
					 As "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" resounded forth, myriads of fire columns shot up to the sky, making thunderous sound.
					
					 Kaleidoscopic fireworks were displayed as if offering respects and greetings to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The display of fascinating fireworks continued amid the playing of songs "July 27 March" and "Holiday of Great War Victory".
					
					 Fireworks of various shapes and colors were displayed nonstop as if reflecting the immense reverence of all service personnel and people for Kim Jong Il who provided a sure guarantee for the bright future of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					 The atmosphere of the anniversary of war victory revved up amid the playing of song "Revolutionary Armed Forces Upholds Leadership of Marshal Only" which reflects the will of the army and people of the DPRK to remain loyal to Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The spectacular and fascinating scenery of fireworks hardened the conviction of the army and people that only victory and glory are in store for the DPRK.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials and officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organization, ministries and national institutions visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Seen standing before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il was a floral basket in the name of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also seen there was a floral basket in the name of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Laid before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 The participants paid high tribute to the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, the participants paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Foreigners and Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners and Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys, representatives of international organizations and military attaches of foreign embassies here and other foreign guests and overseas Koreans staying in the homeland visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, they paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives. 
					
					 The chief and staff members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front also visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on the same day to pay tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill  on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Seen standing before the statues was a floral basket sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Laid before the statues were floral baskets in the name of the party, armed forces and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and institutions, industrial establishments, farms and schools in Pyongyang and bouquets and flowers.
					
					 Also laid was a floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 The participants made bows to the statues.
					
					 Floral baskets, bouquets and flowers were also placed before the statues and portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Military University, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, the Mansudae Art Studio and other parts in Pyongyang in the name of KPA units, institutions, enterprises, etc. 
					
					 Service personnel, working people and school youth and children across the country visited the statues and portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in their residential areas to pay high tribute to them. 
					
					 Foreign campers groups to participate in the 29th Songdowon International Children's Camping visited the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Sunday.
					
					 The campers laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Wreaths and Floral Baskets Laid before Cemeteries
articles.content:
Wreaths and Floral Baskets Laid before Cemeteries 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and floral baskets before the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Seen at the wreath-laying stands of the cemeteries were wreaths and a floral basket sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the wreath- and floral basket-laying ceremonies were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Placed at the wreath-laying stand of the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Laid at the wreath-laying stand of the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and "Soul of Heroes", the wreath-laying stand of the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery, were wreaths and floral baskets in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the SPA of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet. 
					
					 Also placed were wreaths and floral baskets in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA and the KPISF, institutions of science, education, literature and arts, public health and media, and party and power organs, institutions, factories and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants honored the memory of the martyrs.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the local party and power organs, working people's organizations, units of the KPA and the KPISF, industrial establishments, farms, schools and bouquets and flowers were also laid before statues of martyrs, cemeteries of martyrs, monuments to fallen fighters of the KPA and graves of martyrs across the country on the same day.
					
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremonies were officials of the local party and power organs, working people's organizations and industrial establishments, service personnel of the KPA and the KPISF, working people, school youth and children.
					
					 The participants paid high tribute to the martyrs.

articles.title: Dancing Parties of Youth and Students Held
articles.content:
Dancing Parties of Youth and Students Held
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youth and students took place across the country on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 As song "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" resounded forth at the plazas of the Monument to Party Founding, the Arch of Triumph, the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and other venues in the city, youth and students presented cheerful dances, looking back on the feats for war victory performed by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They danced to the tunes of songs like "July 27, Our Victory Day" and "Holiday of Great War Victory" with the pride and happiness of being the young vanguard of Songun Korea which has won victories only century after century.
					
					 They enthusiastically danced to the tunes of songs "Our General Is the Best" and "Nilliri for Songun", looking back on the revolutionary life of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The atmosphere revved up as songs "Joy of the People", "July 27 March" and "Train to the Front" resounded forth.
					
					 Dancing parties were full of enthusiasm of youth and students who were confident that the proud history of victory of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea will last forever as it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Similar dancing parties took place in different parts of the provincial seats, cities and counties on the same day.

articles.title: Large Chorus of School Youth and Children Given
articles.content:
Large Chorus of School Youth and Children Given 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A large chorus of school youth and children in Pyongyang "Forward towards Final Victory" was given at Kim Il Sung Square on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Youth and students presented the waltz of celebrations to the tunes of songs "Tell, Fireworks of War Victory" and "Holiday of Great War Victory".
					
					 In large chorus "Cantata to Marshal Kim Il Sung" and kayagum solo and chorus "Nilliri for Songun" the performers sang high praises of the immortal feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who brought about the day of the second liberation by wisely leading the army and the people of the DPRK and made sure that the ever-victorious history and tradition are given steady continuity on this land.
					
					 The stage of true stories by war veterans "July 27, Victory Day in the War, Should Be Continued through Generations" and poem "Accept This Flag" fully reflected the fighting spirit displayed by heroic soldiers in the war in the 1950s. 
					
					 Trumpet trio and chorus "For My Only Motherland" and brass music and Taekwon-Do "Pyongyang Nalpharam" showed the firm determination of the rising generation to live and struggle like heroes just as those of the preceding generation did.
					
					 Among the audience were Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned, war veterans and school youth and children in the city.

articles.title: Art Performance Given by KPA Song and Dance Ensemble
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by KPA Song and Dance Ensemble
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- An art performance "We Have Only Victory Day, July 27" was given by the Korean People's Army (KPA) Song and Dance Ensemble at the April 25 House of Culture on Sunday, the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials, officials of party and armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, officials of institutions and industrial establishments in Pyongyang, service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, heroes, war veterans and labor innovators.
					
					 Present there on invitation were overseas Koreans staying in the homeland, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations and military attaches of foreign embassies here and their spouses and other foreign guests.
					
					 The performance began with preludes "July 27 March" and "Tell, Fireworks of War Victory". Put on the stage were choruses "Cantata to Marshal Kim Il Sung", kayagum ensemble and male pangchang "Song of Mt. Maebong", dance "Army and People in the Same Trench", accordion duet and orchestra "The Sound of a Horse's Hooves in Mt. Paektu", male solo and dance "Red Chol Pass", chorus "General of Korea" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by winning the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and bringing about one victory after another in the stand-off with the imperialists and the U.S. by dint of Songun and thus turning the DPRK into a matchless military power.
					
					 Wartime songs were put on the stage in orchestra and chorus.
					
					 Also put on the stage were dance "Frontline Soldiers", mixed trio and chorus "I Will Remain Your Son Forever" and instrumental music and song "At a Stroke".
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: War Museum in Pyongyang
articles.content:
War Museum in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum in the DPRK tells about the feats Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in leading the war to victory and pursuing the Songun (military-first) policy.
					 The museum, located at the Pothong River bank in the capital city of Pyongyang, was remodeled into a monumental edifice last year, the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953), under the care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un. This reflects his deep respects to the war victors in the 1950s.
					
					 At the museum, Pak Pong Nyo, a war veteran, told KCNA:
					
					 I've visited the remodeled museum three times. The visit carries me back to the war period.
					
					 Here we, war veterans, recall with great honor Generalissimo Kim Il Sung's undying feats for the war victory as well as the days of victories won by the DPRK in the postwar period. And we express deep thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for the loving care he has shown for the war veterans.
					
					 In fact, Kim Jong Un initiated the reconstruction of the museum and gave on-site guidance to it on 18 occasions. He also offered his autograph "Respects to the Great Age" to be displayed at the sculpture "Victory".
					
					 According to a lecturer of the museum, it has been visited by nearly 800 000 people from home and abroad over the last one year.
					
					 The museum shows the visitors how the DPRK could win in the face-off with the U.S. in the 1950s and hardens their will to build a thriving socialist nation at the earliest date under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: War Victory Day of Korean People Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
War Victory Day of Korean People Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries from July 17 to 19 to mark the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They included meetings and film shows in Benin, Switzerland and Myanmar.
					
					 Present at the events were personages of the Socialist Party of Benin, the Switzerland-Korea Committee, the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Myanmar Medical Research Institute and masses.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Reply of Korea" and "Arms of Korea".
					
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, said:
					
					 When the U.S. ignited the Korean war on June 25, 1950 by prodding the south Korean puppet army, President Kim Il Sung set forth a strategy for the Korean People's Army to make a switchover to a counteroffensive immediately. This was a new strategy of counteroffensive that could not be found in the existing military theories and manuals and experience of other countries.
					
					 The vice-president of the party said the President advanced unique military war methods in the Fatherland Liberation War and made sure that the Korean People's Army actively used them to record shining pages in the history of modern war.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said the service personnel and people of the DPRK won a historic victory in the three year-long Fatherland Liberation War under the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, noted the history of the victory the Korean people achieved in the war by defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of their invincibility will shine long along with the century. 
					
					 Messages of greeting to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events held in Benin and Switzerland.

articles.title: Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, foreigners and overseas Koreans are visiting the Historic Site Associated with the Fatherland Liberation War on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the war. The site is associated with the feats for war victory performed by President Kim Il Sung.
					 The site is a place where the President led the army and people of the DPRK to the final victory of the war after setting up the Supreme Command there from January, Juche 40 (1951) to July, Juche 42 (1953).
					
					 There are in the site such historical buildings as the commanding post and operation room of the Supreme Command, the place where he had a picture taken after being awarded the title of Marshal of the DPRK, the place where he had a talk with heroes of the Republic and model soldiers, etc.
					
					 This year it has been visited by those of Kim Il Sung Military University, Kim Il Sung University, Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex and many other units.
					
					 The visitors saw round historic data and relics in which the President indicated the orientation and ways for postwar rehabilitation and construction.
					
					 They were briefed on the fact that he planned to build a modern poultry industry and showed benevolence for the fighters of Height 1211.
					
					 They also heard the explanation about the personality of leader Kim Jong Il as a great man who cultivated the outstanding military idea, war methods, gifted stratagem and commanding art of the President while staying near the operation table of the Supreme Command.
					
					 Foreigners and overseas Koreans admired the feats of the President who wrought a military miracle to shine in the human history of war by defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world.

articles.title: News Analyst: U.S. Should Feel Shame
articles.content:
News Analyst: U.S. Should Feel Shame
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- It has been 61 years since the Korean people won the great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953). 
					 But the U.S. has been shamelessly keen on misleading the public opinion as if the war were ended in a victory for it. It seems that the U.S. is oblivious of miserable defeat it suffered from the war.
					
					 At that time, the world public opinion described the Korean war as the one between adult and child, as it had been only two years since the foundation of the DPRK. 
					
					 During the war the U.S. mobilized huge armed forces and military capabilities, resorting to every conceivable means unprecedented in history.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. suffered a miserable defeat in the war for the first time in its history.
					
					 When the U.S. tasted a defeat in the general Christmas offensive with its five corps involved, New York Herald Tribune in an article branded it as the biggest defeat ever seen in the U.S. army history. 
					
					 It was the first time in the world history of sea battles that four torpedo boats of the Korean People's Army sank down a U.S. heavy cruiser. And during a week of October 1951 alone, the U.S. air force lost 20 "B-29" bombers.
					
					 Through the aircraft-hunting team movement, the KPA shot down 3 000 U.S. warplanes in two years.
					
					 As regards the continuous defeats the U.S. suffered during the war, New York Times said the U.S. soldiers and officers have been keenly aware that arms superiority can not guarantee victory.
					
					 After covering the 158th meeting of the armistice talk on July 19, 1953, the Western correspondents reported that the UN forces hung the white flag without any condition.
					
					 Former U.S. Secretary of Defense Marshall confessed that the myth of "mightiness" of the U.S. was broken and the U.S. was no longer the strongest country as other countries believed.
					
					 MacArthur, the then commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East, deplored that the Korean War was evidently and undoubtedly a failure.
					
					 The U.S. had better keep in its mind the shameless defeat it suffered from the Korean war.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Victory in Fatherland Liberation War (4)
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Victory in Fatherland Liberation War (4)
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- During the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War, President Kim Il Sung frustrated the U.S. imperialist strategic schemes and turned the war situation in favor of the Korean People's Army with his superb war tactics.
					 It was one day in late January Juche 40 (1951) that Kim Il Sung called at a command post of the KPA to take a step against the enemy's tanks.
					
					 Informed that it was hard to use artillery pieces in destroying the enemy's tanks in daytime because of its warplanes, he suggested organizing tank-hunting teams, saying that the enemy tanks could not move freely apart from roads, due to the topographical conditions of Korea, which has lots of marshlands in its western part and mountainous areas in its central and eastern parts.
					
					 Advising KPA officers to take advantage of such weak point of the enemy's tanks, he stressed the need to launch a tank-hunting team movement so as to contain the mobility of the enemy tanks. Any tank without mobility is as good as a dead tiger, he added.
					
					 After all, tank-hunting teams came into being at the KPA units, and they destroyed more than 200 enemy tanks in 1952 alone.

articles.title: Greetings to National Executive Committee of People's Democratic Party of Nigeria
articles.content:
Greetings to National Executive Committee of People's Democratic Party of Nigeria
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greeting to the National Executive Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria on Sunday on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of its founding.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger, sincerely wishing the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria greater successes in its future activities to strengthen the party and achieve the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Pays Attention to Developing Nation's Sports in Wartime
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Pays Attention to Developing Nation's Sports in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung had paid deep attention to developing the nation's sports even in the thick of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					 In August 1951 when the war was at its height, he dispatched a DPRK sports delegation, organized with servicepersons, to the World Festival of Youth and Students in Berlin to show the mettle of the heroic Korean people.
					
					 When the delegate returned home, he appreciated its members for their successes in the festival.
					
					 Considering the sports development to be an important work related to the nation's honor, he made a decision to recall athletes from the front in order to organize a sports group in the Korean People's Army. To that effect, he issued Order No. 0644 in the name of the Supreme Commander on December 15, Juche 40 (1951).
					
					 Days later, a meeting took place at the conference room of the Supreme Command to declare the organizing of the KPA Sports Group with some 100 servicepersons for 10 events including football, basketball and volleyball.
					
					 On May 1, 1952, Kim Il Sung personally watched a match of the group's women volleyballers.
					
					 He even called the athletes to take part in the military parade for celebrating the war victory.
					
					 The feats he performed for sports development in the wartime will shine forever along with the war victory.

articles.title: Campers Groups Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Campers Groups Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign and overseas Korean campers groups to participate in the 29th Songdowon International Children's Camping visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the life of the President, they looked round the historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae with much care.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the head of the Tanzanian international children's camping group said:
					
					 The visit offered an opportunity to come to know about the history of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The President was born at a simple thatched house and devoted his all to the country and its people.
					
					 He was an outstanding leader and tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 The Korean people are, indeed, blessed with illustrious leaders.
					
					 The deputy head of a Russian children's camping group expressed her surprise at the fact that the President was born into a simple family and grew up to be a great revolutionary, adding that it was for this background that he could liberate the country and build prosperous socialist Korea. It is pleasure for the campers to come to know about his childhood, she stressed.
					
					 They also visited the Arch of Triumph, Pyongyang Folklore Park, Rungna Dolphinarium, etc.

articles.title: Lecture Given by Chongryon to Mark War Victory Day
articles.content:
Lecture Given by Chongryon to Mark War Victory Day
 Tokyo, July 26 (KNS-KCNA) -- A lecture was given by the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Saturday to mark the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were vice-chairpersons and department directors of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, senior officials of organizations and enterprises, Chongryon officials in Kanto area and teachers of Korean University.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, gave a lecture under the title "On Songun leadership of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is leading showdown with the U.S. to final victory."
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address for 2014 called this year a year of grandiose struggle and a year of sea changes to usher in the period of prosperity of Songun Korea.
					
					 The on-going all-out confrontation with the U.S. is the one between Juche-based socialism and imperialism in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields and the struggle to prevail over imperialism by giving fullest play to the advantages and might of socialism, he noted, adding:
					
					 The day of a decisive victory in the all-out confrontation with the U.S. is not far as there is the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 On the same day its participants watched a Korean film dealing with the Korean People's Army that has developed into an invincible revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: "Saenuri Party" of S. Korea Slammed for Blocking Probe into Truth about Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident
articles.content:
"Saenuri Party" of S. Korea Slammed for Blocking Probe into Truth about Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea Thursday issued a statement denouncing the "Saenuri Party" for blocking the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol sinking accident.
					 The statement accused Ju Ho Yong, chairman of the Policy Committee of the "Saenuri Party," of likening the ferry Sewol sinking disaster to a traffic accident and saying that the reparation for Sewol sinking disaster should not exceed that paid to the victims of the Cheonan warship sinking case.
					
					 This is a nonsense insulting the true minds of the bereaved families desirous of the probe into the truth about the disaster, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Sim Jae Chol, lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party," was also recently blamed for opposing the institution of a special law on the Sewol sinking disaster.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is turning its face away from the true minds of the bereaved families and insulting them as those just demanding reparation in a bid to block the probe.
					
					 It should stop distorting truth and making false remarks and opt for immediately instituting the special law.
					
					 If the party repeats its acts of going against the public mindset, Chongwadae and the party will have to bear responsibilities for them, the statement concluded.

articles.title: Papers Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Winning Victory in War
articles.content:
Papers Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Winning Victory in War
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Papers here carry editorials in praise of the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in winning the victory in the war.
					
					 The war in the 1950s was a hard-fought revolutionary war unprecedented in the world history of war.
					
					 No wonder, the international community watched with great concern the war between the less than two-year old DPRK and the U.S. imperialists with the history of more than hundred years of aggression.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK wrought a historical miracle of defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world" by displaying matchless heroism and self-sacrificing spirit in the war characterized by the great imbalance of power.
					
					 The victory in the war was the brilliant one of the ideology and faith, strategies, tactics and commanding art of Kim Il Sung, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 His matchless grit and pluck served as an ideological and mental source that encouraged the army and people of the DPRK to display the spirit of certain victory and popular heroism, and his original strategies, tactics and war methods were a powerful treasured sword that enabled to overpower the numerical and technical superiorities of the enemy.
					
					 Led by him the DPRK fought a victorious war from the beginning, recording the whole course of the war with brilliant gains and feats.
					
					 He brought about the second liberation day by beating back the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and opened a new era of surge in the struggle against imperialism. These feats are unprecedented in the history of the Korean nation and the human history of politics.
					
					 Minju Joson says that Kim Il Sung who brought about a shining victory admired by the world will live forever in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives as a symbol of victory of anti-imperialist independent cause, ever-victorious outstanding strategist and a legendary hero.

articles.title: Korea Itself Is Attractive: Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
Korea Itself Is Attractive: Russian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Teleport on July 2 devoted two whole pages to the travelogue of the DPRK written by A. I. Donchenko, chairman of the Russian Blagobeshensk Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					 The paper carried the travelogue titled "Korea Itself Is Attractive" illustrated with a photo of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					
					 He wrote that the DPRK celebrates the birth anniversary of the President with splendor every spring, and added that the celebrations of the Day of the Sun were held this year, too, with the attendance of delegations and figures from all walks of life of many countries.
					
					 He wrote in detail about looks of Pyongyang where the world-startling grand monumental buildings and cultural and welfare establishments, skyscrapers, high-rise apartment buildings, etc. sprang up under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un in a short span of time, and which turned into a big park.
					
					 He also wrote on recent miracles and innovations performed by the service personnel and the people of the country in all fields of building an economic power.
					
					 He wrote that whenever I visit the DPRK, I fully realize that the reality in the DPRK is quite different from what was reported by the Western media.
					
					 The reason that I was moved by the country is because of the charm of the Korean society where all are leading a happy life, and the Korean people who are true, kind, diligent and trustworthy, he concluded.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un vuelve a dirigir entrenamiento de lanzamiento de cohetes del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un vuelve a dirigir entrenamiento de lanzamiento de cohetes del EPC
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, volvio a dirigir en el terreno el entrenamiento de lanzamiento de cohetes de las fuerzas estrategicas del EPC.
					 En el entrenamiento realizado un dia antes del dia de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, participaron la unidad de ataque de las fuerzas estrategicas del EPC que asume la mision de golpear las bases de las tropas agresoras norteamericanas estacionadas en suelo surcoreano.
					
					 Tras revisar el actual estado de ubicacion de las bases de las tropas norteamericanas en suelo surcoreano y el plan de lanzamiento trazado suponiendo el ataque contra ellas, el Comandante Supremo dirigio el entrenamiento de lanzamiento.
					
					 En esta ocasion tambien fueron calificadas de perfectas la combatividad de la unidad de ataque y la funcion combativa de cohetes  tacticos.
					
					 Recientemente, se habia realizado mucho el entrenamiento de lanzamiento de ensayo para desarrollar la ciencia y la tecnologia autoctonas de cohete y el metodo de disparo, dijo y agrego que como resultado, las fuerzas estrategicas estan dispuestas a cumplir satisfactoriamente cualquiera mision de golpe en la guerra moderna. Se mostro muy satisfecho de los exitos de los reiterados entrenamientos de las fuerzas estrategicas, diciendo que las detonaciones del presente entrenamiento son iguales a un canonazo que avisa la terminacion de los preparativos de combate de las fuerzas estrategicas.
					
					 Nunca se puede modificar ni ocultar ni inventar la historia, dijo y agrego que en visperas del 27 de julio, los yanquis tratan de disfrazar su derrota como "victoria" emitiendo la "proclama" infundada de Obama y el "discurso conmemorativo de la presidenta" de Park Geun-hye, en vez de sacar la leccion de su amarga derrota sufrida en la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					 Desde la decada de los 50 del siglo pasado hasta la fecha fueron cambiados los duenos de la Casa Blanca, pero es invariable la politica hostil a la RPDC de EE.UU., dijo y continuo que historicamente EE.UU. sufrio la derrota por nuestros golpes rotundos, lo que es la tradicion vergonzosa del imperialismo norteamericano, pero tenemos la orgullosa tradicion de  haber frustrado paso a paso las maniobras insolentes de EE.UU. Y enfatizo que estas dos tradiciones logicas e invariables continuaran en el futuro tambien.
					
					 Acoto que sucumbiran todos los desafiadores a la justa causa del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea y asevero que debemos lograr sin falta la causa historica de la reunificacion de la patria tras aniquilar cuanto antes a las tropas agresoras norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea y sus seguidores.
					
					 Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Yun Tong Hyon, Ri Pyong Chol, O Kum Chol y Pak Jong Chon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un ve competencia de voleibol entre equipos 25 de Abril y Amnokgang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un ve competencia de voleibol entre equipos 25 de Abril y Amnokgang
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, vio junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la competencia de voleibol entre los equipos 25 de Abril y Amnokgang, con motivo del 61o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					 Los dos equipos mostraron excelentes escenas poniendo de pleno manifiesto tecnicas deportivas adiestradas en tiempo ordinario.
					
					 En el partido, el equipo 25 de Abril vencio al Amnokgang.
					
					 Mostrandose satisfecho de que los voleibolistas hayan realizado la competencia de alto nivel, el Mariscal los felicito por su exito.
					
					 Subrayo que deben perfeccionar la tecnologia deportiva, sistema de tacticas y metodos de ejercicios a nuestro estilo, para elevar mas el nivel de tecnologia deportiva del pais, de modo que se logren brillantes exitos en los juegos internacionales.
					
					 Senalando que convertir nuestro pais en una potencia deportiva es la labor de suma importancia para fortalecer por todos los medios el poderio estatal y manifestar a todo el mundo el indoblegable impetu y la dignidad de la Corea del Songun, presento las tareas que sirven de guia en el desarrollo trascendental de deportes del pais.
					
					 Le acompanaron en verla Hwang Pyong So, O Kum Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Jae Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Yong Hun y Ri Jong Mu.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 61o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito a la hora 0 del dia 27 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					 Entro en el hall donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					
					 El jefe de la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del EPC y del Ejercito Rojo Obrero-Campesino dio el parte de recepcion hacia las estatuas.
					
					 Seguidamente, fueron colocados al pie de estas un cesto de flores en nombre del Mariscal y el otro a nombre del EPC.
					
					 Junto con los participantes, el Mariscal rindio homenaje a los Generalisimos ante sus estatuas.
					
					 A continuacion, entro en el salon de eternidad donde esta conservado el cuerpo del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Volvio a rendirle homenaje junto con los participantes y recorrio el hall de llantos y las salas de conservacion de las ordenes, el vagon de tren y el carro usados por el Presidente.
					
					 En el salon de eternidad donde esta conservado el cuerpo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el Mariscal le rindio tributo junto con los participantes y paso revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes, el carro, el coche electrico, el barco y el vagon de tren usados por el Dirigente.
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Hyon Yong Chol, Pyon In Son, So Hong Chan, Pak Yong Sik, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol y otros comandantes del EPC y miembros de mando de las unidades de tipos de ejercito y a nivel de cuerpo del EPC.
